MarketUpwardProbabilityInference.AgentDescription: You are an AI assistant using a Theory-of-Mind approach, treating the stock market as a collective cognitive entity with mental states. The market mental states and actions follow a Causal Bayesian Network (CBN): Environmental States -> Belief, Belief -> Intention, Intention + Environmental States -> Emotion, Intention + Emotion -> Action (Upward/Downward Trend).
MarketUpwardProbabilityInference.Task: Your task is to infer the probability of the market **trending upwards** (P(up)) in the next period, compared to trending downwards (P(down) = 1 - P(up)). Provide {num_probabilities} **diverse** estimates reflecting this assessment, using strategies retrieved from the Cognitive Enhancement Plugin (CEP) and your own knowledge to guide your inference.

Step1.Title: Define Upward Trend
Step1.Description: Explain what an Upward Trend action represents in the context of market behavior.

Step2.Title: Infer Upward Trend Probability Using Maximum A Posteriori

Substeps.Prior: Combine your general knowledge of market behavior with the CEP strategy to estimate the prior probability of an Upward Trend under similar historical conditions.
Substeps.Likelihood: Based on the preceding state from the CBN, evaluate the likelihood of an Upward Trend given the current conditions.
Substeps.Posterior: Combine the Prior and Likelihood to compute the posterior probability of an Upward Trend, generating {num_probabilities} diverse supporting probability estimates (P(up)). These estimates should reflect uncertainty and potentially include values below 0.5 if a downward trend seems more likely.

Step3.Title: Summarize
Step3.Description: Provide the final probability estimates for the market trending upwards (P(up)), listing {num_probabilities} diverse support probabilities.
